name: Forge Bug Reporter
description: Lightweight in-app bug reporter for Forge with clipboard-paste screenshot support, Postgres storage, and R2 screenshot uploads.

tasks.title: Scope requirements and write acceptance criteria
subtasks: Read Forge codebase: routes, schema, R2 integration, modal patterns, AppShell layout, shared validation
Rewrote requirements doc from scratch (previous version was for TeamHQ with voice recording -- entirely different scope)
Defined 5 user stories: keyboard shortcut, floating button, clipboard paste, submit, bug list
Wrote interaction states checklist for bug list and modal (loading, error, disabled, empty, form, timeout)
Specified Postgres data model (bugs table) following existing Drizzle patterns
Defined 5 API endpoints following existing Express router patterns
Wrote validation schemas following existing Zod patterns in shared/src/validation.ts
Classified all 15 files (8 new, 7 modify) with no Restructure classifications
Recommended pipeline: Andrei, Robert, Alice+Jonah parallel, Robert review, Enzo QA
Identified 3 risks: keyboard shortcut conflict, R2 dev config, large Retina screenshots
decisions: Clipboard paste over html2canvas -- CEO tested html2canvas and it failed with SVGs, clipboard paste is simpler and more reliable
Postgres+R2 over local filesystem -- Forge already has both, no reason to invent a different storage pattern
Dropped voice recording/AI transcription from previous spec -- clipboard paste + typed description is faster and has zero dependencies
Single screenshot per bug -- keeps the flow fast, multiple attachments deferred
Auto-capture page URL -- low effort, high value for debugging context
Skipped Nina/Soren/Amara -- the modal is a standard form pattern, no complex interactions or responsive challenges
